metadata.title: FA Understand 26 02

config.question: Which statement best assesses the National Recovery Administration?

choices.content: The program was hugely successful in the long-term but produced few immediate results.
It was a short-lived program that died under its own weight.
The program established a long-lived alliance between labor and management.
It established a successful partnership between labor and government.

answer_3.response: Consider This: In the midst of the depression, business owners were intent on stabilizing production and raising prices. The NRA was a failure of voluntary cooperation between these three groups. See L.O. 26.2 Fighting the Depression.

answer_1.response: Consider This: In the midst of the depression, business owners were intent on stabilizing production and raising prices. The NRA was a failure of voluntary cooperation between these three groups. See L.O. 26.2 Fighting the Depression.

answer_4.response: Consider This: In the midst of the depression, business owners were intent on stabilizing production and raising prices. The NRA was a failure of voluntary cooperation between these three groups. See L.O. 26.2 Fighting the Depression.
